summary:
http://gusmachado.work

Gus Machado is an award winning creative working with advertising and music.

Formerly an art director and currently a copywriter, Gus spent the last decade working in the south cone and living in Chile, Argentina and Brazil. During this time, he has been helping both startups and established brands like Netflix, Google, Facebook, and Volkswagen; government agencies like the Buenos Aires Creative Economy Department and advertising agencies like MullenLowe, DDB and AKQA. 

His work was recognized at Cannes, D&AD, The Webby Awards, El Ojo, El Sol, Fiap, among other national organizations like Brazilian Clube de Criação and Argentinian Circulo de Creativos. 
As an advocate for creativity, Gus mentors the new creative generation as a Creative Process Teacher for Brazilian Cannes Partner Redhook School and has been leading the São Paulo chapter of Japans' creativity NGO "Pechakucha".

He is also a regular collaborator for the non-profit global creative collective addressing social issues, Papel e Caneta.

As a musician, Gus is a multi instrumentalist composer and music producer with a number of singles, EP's and collaborations published.

awards: [{'title': 'Wood Pencil / Digital / Branded Apps & Games ', 'description': 'Stranger Antenna was a stunt made for Netflix’s Stranger Things season 3. It was an app that warmed Brazilian fans up for the third season by giving them the first chance of a sneak peek at unreleased new Stranger Things scenes. This could only be done by mimicking an old national habit, common in the 80s, of putting steel wool on TV antennas to improve the signal. With Stranger Antenna, fans had to put a steel wool pad near their phones in order to tune in to new ST3 scenes and exclusive content created only for the app.\n', 'issuer': 'D&AD', 'date': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}}, {'title': 'Webby Awards Nominee / Advertising, Media & PR / Best Use of Mobile Media', 'description': 'Stranger Antenna', 'issuer': 'The Webby Awards', 'date': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}}, {'title': 'Bronze/  Film / El Ojo de Iberoamerica', 'description': None, 'issuer': 'LatinSpots', 'date': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}}, {'title': 'Mention of Honor / Print / Diente', 'description': None, 'issuer': 'Circulo de Creativos Argentinos', 'date': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}}, {'title': 'Silver / Integrated / El Sol de Iberoamerica', 'description': None, 'issuer': '(AEACP) Spanish Advertising Agencies Association.', 'date': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}}, {'title': 'Bronce at Diente 2013 - Radio', 'description': None, 'issuer': 'Círculo de Creativos Argentinos', 'date': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}}, {'title': 'Silver at Diente 2013 - Student Category', 'description': None, 'issuer': None, 'date': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}}, {'title': 'Shortlist at FIAP 2013 - New Talents', 'description': None, 'issuer': 'Festival Ibero Americano de Publicidade', 'date': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}}, {'title': 'Finalist (3º) - El Ojo de Iberoamerica - New Talents', 'description': None, 'issuer': 'LatinSpots', 'date': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}}, {'title': 'Gold at Diente 2012 - Student Category', 'description': None, 'issuer': 'Círculo de Creativos Argentinos', 'date': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}}, {'title': 'Shortlist at Prêmios Clarín de Publicidade - SUB-25 category', 'description': None, 'issuer': 'Grupo Clarín', 'date': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}}]
projects: [{'title': 'Exploradores do Saber', 'date': {'start': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'description': 'Freelance. Story, character, riddles and puzzles creation for an ARG (Alternative Reality Game) called Exploradores do Saber. Developed as part of a promo for Tiradentes University.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Gus', 'last_name': 'Machado', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Creative | Music Producer'}]}, {'title': 'Fusca Fosco', 'date': {'start': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'description': 'Fusca Fosco is an art collective created by three friends that met each other working in ad agencies and thought that they could have a lot of things in common besides their career. The project came up through a shared interest for comics, humor and distinct narrative formats, plus the need to get away from deadlines and job approvals. What started as an escape valve became a creative and constant exercise, free from any barrier including a geographical one: with integrants from São Paulo to Buenos Aires, the process of thinking about each comic strip is a great interchange of techniques, experiences, and, sometimes weird situations. ', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Gus', 'last_name': 'Machado', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Creative | Music Producer'}]}, {'title': 'Road to Joy', 'date': {'start': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'description': 'Road to Joy is an indie/folk rock band. volunteer_experiences: [{'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'role': 'São Paulo Organizer', 'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'PechaKucha', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4E0BAQHnVhTSa_vxkw/company-logo_400_400/0/1619720000677?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=UKqeb4_ZNe2aUWBR_nTMu2OmdesCiWx7dA9PfN63_AU', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/pechakucha/'}, 'cause': 'ARTS_AND_CULTURE', 'description': 'PechaKucha is a storytelling format where a presenter shows 20 slides for 20 seconds of commentary each (6 minutes and 40 seconds total). At a PechaKucha Night, individuals gather at a venue to share personal presentations about their work. The PechaKucha format can be used, for example, in business presentations to clients or staff, as well as in education settings.'}, {'date': {'start': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'role': 'Creative Collaborator', 'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'Papel e Caneta', 'logo': None, 'url': None}, 'cause': 'HUMAN_RIGHTS', 'description': 'Paper & Caneta (Paper & Pen) is a nonprofit collective made up of global leaders and young people from creative agencies all over the world who are tired of waiting for change to happen. By change, we mean a real transformation in the way the advertising industry operates with so much competition. Transformation of the way that people approach social problems, which is often just a reading and talking but with little action.'}]
